meanings.definition: Imitating someone or something, typically for amusement or to deceive.
meanings.sent1: The children put on a mimicking play of their favorite story.
meanings.sent2: Her mimicking behavior of the teacher made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's mimicking of the dog's bark was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The chameleon's mimicking of the leaf's color was remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's mimicking of famous actors was spot-on.

meanings.definition: Copying the actions or speech of someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was mimicking her sister's dance moves in the living room.
meanings.sent2: The toddler was mimicking the sounds of animals he heard at the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept mimicking the chef's movements in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The waves mimicking the dance of the palm trees on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The student was mimicking the pronunciation of difficult words in the language class.
